alert.note: Alert for Coastal Charlotte; Coastal Hillsborough; Coastal Lee; Coastal Manatee; Coastal Sarasota; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Inland Charlotte; Inland Hillsborough; Inland Lee; Inland Manatee; Inland Sarasota; Pinellas; Polk (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 18 at 2:46PM EDT until April 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...Critical relative humidity, elevated northerly winds, and high ERC values will result in an elevated fire danger on Tuesday... .Humidity values will decrease tomorrow in the wake of a cold front. Meanwhile, breezy conditions coupled with low afternoon humidity and high ERC values will combine to create an elevated fire danger. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST FLORIDA... The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Area - Ruskin FL has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Pinellas...Polk...Hardee...Highlands... DeSoto...Coastal Hillsborough...Coastal Manatee...Coastal Sarasota...Coastal Charlotte...Coastal Lee...Inland Hillsborough...Inland Manatee...Inland Sarasota...Inland Charlotte...Inland Lee. * WIND...North winds sustained around 15 mph with gusts to 20 mph. * HUMIDITY...25-35 percent. * ERC...30 to 50. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
